Welcome to Getting Funky III 2024!

 

CET is very excited to have you join us for our annual cultural exchange program January 11-15, 2024 in Havana, Cuba!

 

In order to comply with Cuba travel requirments and secure proper accomodations we ask that each traveler that will be joining us completes a registration below. 

 

TRAVELER INFORMATION:

Please fill out the form below to the best of your ability.  *Please select "People to People" from the dropdown at the bottom of the page for your reason of travel.

 

PASSPORT AND VISA:

All travelers are required to carry a valid passport and a Cuban visa. The visa will be secured by Cuba Educational Travel representative and sent to the trip leader beforehand.

 

IMPORTANT:

Those without a valid passport will not be allowed to enter. Passport should be valid for a minimum of 6 months after departure date. Cuba Educational Travel is not responsible for lost or stolen passports in Cuba.

 

*You can select your travel reason as "people to people" below.

MEMO OF UNDERSTANDING / SALES AGREEMENT
Robert & Breigh Cruz - 1st Anniversary Trip
July 20-29, 2019

 

 

Please carefully read our company policies listed below. It is your responsibility to inquire about and fully understand change and cancellation policies regarding your travel arrangements.

 

 

GROUND PACKAGE: 

$3,540 per person, double occupancy       

 

INCLUDED   

  • 9-nights’ accommodations in Cuba
    • 5 nights in Havana at the Hotel Kempinski (Deluxe Room)
    • 3 nights in Varadero at the all-inclusive Iberostar Varadero (Double Room)
    • 1 night in Havana at the Hotel Saratoga (Jr. Suite)
  • Daily breakfast
  • Meals (as specified on the itinerary)
  • Meal reservations (as specified on the itinerary)
  • Professional, bilingual guide for listed activities
  • Local ground transportation for listed activities
  • Pre-trip departure information
  • Compliance with U.S. Treasury Department regulations
  • Speaker fees
  • Admission to all museums and public buildings listed in itinerary
  • Coordination of all listed activities

 

NOT INCLUDED

  • Optional day trip to the Viñales Valley ($300 per person)
  • Round-trip airfare
    • Cuban Visa (visas for non-Cuban born travelers are available for purchase from U.S. airlines. In some instances, CET can process your visa for $100 per traveler)
  • Meals and activities other than listed on itinerary
  • Individual house or hotel expenses (mini bar, room service, laundry fees, etc.)
  • Tips for local guides, drivers, restaurant service, etc.


TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 

PAYMENT:

  • Full payment is due at this time.
  • A signed copy of the Memorandum of Understanding must be turned in with payment.
  • Please inquire if you are interested in purchasing trip insurance from a certified, third party.

 

Payment can be made with a check, cashier’s check, or money order. Credit cards are not accepted. Checks should be made out to Cuba Educational Travel and mailed to:

 

Cuba Educational Travel

Attn: Robert Cruz

42 Fire Island Ave., Suite 100

Babylon, NY 11702

 

CANCELLATION and REPLACEMENT POLICIES:

  • The sale is final.
  • In some instances, time permitting, a different traveler can take the place of a scheduled participant for a processing fee of $350.
  • If U.S. policy is altered to make it so that the trip is not compliant with U.S. law regarding travel to Cuba, a full refund will be granted. This will ONLY be the case if there is no legal avenue for travel to Cuba that would allow for the trip to move forward.

 

UNUSED SERVICES & REFUNDS:

No refund or adjustment can be made for any portion of the services not used such as voluntary non-usage of hotel accommodations, scheduled meals or any planned activity described in your itinerary.

 

PASSPORT AND VISA:

All travelers are required to carry a valid passport and a Cuban visa. Those without a valid passport and visa will not be allowed to enter. Travelers who were born in Cuba may require a special visa in order to enter the country. Passport should be valid for a minimum of 6 months after departure date. You may obtain a visa from CET or the airline and CET will advise on the process.

 

IMPORTANT:

Your trip is designed and implanted to comply with U.S. regulations on travel to Cuba as well as local laws in Cuba. Cuba Educational Travel is not responsible for violations as a result of travelers ignoring advice, altering programs on the ground or breaking Cuban law.

MEMO OF UNDERSTANDING / SALES AGREEMENT

Travel to Cuba with Total Access

Trip 1: February 7-13, 2024 or Trip 2: February 21-27, 2024

 

ABOUT THE TRIP

 

Travel to Cuba for US Citizens is unique in that there are restrictions on how you can travel, and what you can do on the island.   Total Access has partnered with one of the most respected travel outfitters who specializes in Cuba travel, Cuba Educational Travel (CET).    We will be partnering with CET not only for the purposes of ensuring that all of your OFAC permissions are in place, but we also will leverage their network to take full advantage of the connections they have on the island.  

 

CET was established by Collin Laverty in 2012. Collin, today a leading expert on Cuba and U.S.-Cuba relations, began his career with the Center for Democracy in the Americas, bringing U.S. Congressional delegations to Cuba and advocating on Capitol Hill.

 

From CET’s platform, we launched Havana Strategies in 2015, which offered business advisory services to companies such as Airbnb, Google, and Cummins who saw an opportunity to enter the Cuban market after President Obama initiated a process to normalize relations between the US and Cuba in 2014.

 

Prior to the pandemic, CET brought 5000+ travelers per year to Cuba. CET believes the best of Cuba lies in its warm, talented people—and this is brought to you through their access to the country’s top artists, academics, tastemakers, and cultural icons. Their experience spans family trips, VIP travel, student groups, trade & policy delegations, retreats, and large-scale events for Fortune 500 companies. Since 2022, when travel to the island resumed, CET has specialized in the production of numerous YPO and EO Forums, as well as large retreats.   Our experience in producing memorable events is unrivaled, and we are honored to have them as our host partner for the Cuba trip.

UNUSED SERVICES & REFUNDS:

No refund or adjustment can be made for any portion of the services not used such as voluntary non-usage of hotel accommodations, scheduled meals or any planned activity described in your itinerary.

 

PASSPORT AND VISA:

All travelers are required to carry a valid passport and a Cuban visa. Those without a valid passport and visa will not be allowed to enter. IMPORTANT:

Your trip is designed and implanted to comply with U.S. regulations on travel to Cuba as well as local laws in Cuba. Cuba Educational Travel is not responsible for violations as a result of travelers ignoring advice, altering programs on the ground or breaking Cuban law.
